title: DJ Sessions: Collaborative Tunes From Colorado Artists
teaser: This week, we listen from Colorado artists who collaborate together in multiple bands.
contentencoded:
In this week’s installments of the DJ Sessions, Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobston speaks with Alisha Sweeney, host of “Mile High Noon” on Open Air, Colorado Public Radio’s rock station.

Sweeney says that the Colorado music scene is dominated right now by artists who are collaborating with each other, and often in multiple bands.

  • Hear more DJ Sessions

Songs from the Segment

Ark Life, “What You Want To”

[Youtube]

Nathaniel Rateliff, “Nothing to Show for”

[Youtube]

Nathaniel Rateliff & the Night Sweats, “Trying So Hard Not to Know”

Tennis, “Never Work for Free”

Guest

  • Alisha Sweeney, host of “Mile High Noon” on Open Air, Colorado Public Radio’s rock station. She tweets @OpenAirAlisha.
